location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.67 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter concerns Wahhabi movements in Arabia. Kemball writes that he has received a report from the Native Agent at Bahrain, Hajee Jassem, stating that the Wahabee [Wahhabi] forces, led by Abdullah ben Fysul [Abdullah bin Faisal bin Turki] have started their march to Oman, and show no indication of entering the Guttur [Qatar] districts en route. However, Kemball writes that Sheikh Mohamed ben Khuleefa [Muhammad bin Khalifa] remains distrustful of the loyalties of Qatari inhabitants.
